properties.content:
Welcome to Joget DX Showcase App

 

This showcase app features many of the low-code/no-code application development complete with workflow process.

  1. We showcase the individual form element features of Joget.
  2. We showcase the charting capabilities of Joget.
  3. We showcase the workflow capabilities of Joget.

In the workflow example, a user can raise a request and submit to two approvers. The request form displays the use of multipage forms, a variety of form fields, spreadsheet and file/image upload fields. The app is complete with email notification. Approvers can approve the request, instruct the requester to resubmit the form or outright reject the form.

Login to proceed.

 

View of the workflow process design:
properties.label: Welcome

properties.sql:
SELECT c_date, c_name
FROM app_fd_j_meeting_data
ORDER BY c_date ASC

properties.content:
#envVariable.AppName#

This is a showcases of the various types of graphic charts that are available in Joget Enterprise/Professional DX.

The following are features of Joget Charts:

  1. Uses SQL query commands to retrieve and populate the chart.
  2. You can define the height, width and color of the rendered chart.
  3. If you choose bar chart, you can specify to render in horizontal or vertical orientation.
  4. In additional, bar charts allow you to display stack elements.
  5. All charts allow you to key in additional text above and below the chart. This app used the bottom footer to provide additional description about the chart.
  6. Finally, you decide the source of the data (Datasource) or database to 'pull' your data from. It can be an external database outside of Joget.

You can learn how the app generated the charts in userview. To view the chart properties, edit the userview and hover over the chart menu until you see the properties link. Click on the properties link and study the respective chart properties tabs. 

  

Joget Charts Type

Type Description View
Bubble Chart

A bubble chart is a type of chart that displays three dimensions of data. Each entity with its triplet (v1, v2, v3) of associated data is plotted as a disk that expresses two of the vi values through the disk's xy location and the third through its circle size.

View bubble chart
Bar Chart

A bar chart is a diagram in which the numerical values of variables are represented by the height or length of lines or rectangles of equal width.

 View bar chart 1 & 2
Area Chart

An area chart displays graphically quantitative data. It is based on the line chart. The area between axis and line are commonly emphasized with colors, textures and hatchings. Commonly one compares with an area chart two or more quantities.

 View area chart
Line & XY Chart

A line chart is a type of chart which displays information as a series of data points called 'markers' connected by a smooth line segments. The XY Chart displays a straigh line segment.

 View line chart, XY chart
Donut Chart The Donut chart is a Pie chart variation with ability to display single series of data in a two-dimensional circle. It is useful for displaying data as parts of a whole. View donut chart
Pie Chart A pie chart is a type of graph in which a circle is divided into sectors that each represent a proportion of the whole. View pie chart
Stocks Candlestick A candlestick chart is a type of stock market graph. The high is marked by the top of the upper shadow and the low by the bottom of the lower shadow. If the stock closes higher than its opening price, a hollow candlestick is drawn with the bottom of the body representing the opening price and the top of the body representing the closing price. View Candlestick chart
Stock OHLC Chart An open-high-low-close chart (also OHLC chart) is a type of chart typically used to illustrate movements in the price of a financial instrument over time. Each vertical line on the chart shows the price range (the highest and lowest prices) over one unit of time, e.g., one day or one hour. View OHLC chart

 

You can view and edit the standard and stock chart data records. 

Introducing the Preset Form Data Tool plugin, an inbuilt process tool that this app uses to populate the database table to feed data to the bar and stock charts. This process is automatically executed when you log into the app.

This tutorial uses MySQL SQL query syntaxes. If you are running on another database, you can modify the SQL commands in the Userview>SQL Chart properties.

 

Thank you for viewing this tutorial. Do also download the Form Grid tutorial from Joget Marketplace.
properties.label: Documentation

properties.customFooter:
Note: Chart data are real values derived from your Joget system tables.
How to read a bubble chart.
properties.label: Bubble Chart
properties.query:
select
    (select COUNT(*) from app_form s1 where s1.appId=p.appId) as 'TotalForms', /*X value*/
    (select COUNT(*) from app_datalist s2 where s2.appId=p.appId) as 'TotalLists', /*Y value*/
    (select COUNT(*) from app_userview s3 where s3.appId=p.appId) as 'TotalUserviews', /*Size*/
CONCAT(p.name, ' v', p.appVersion) as 'AppName'
from app_app p
group by AppName, TotalForms, TotalLists, TotalUserviews
limit 10
properties.title: Bubble Chart: Total Forms, Datalist & Userview In App

properties.customFooter: Note: Fictitious data for illustration purposes only.
properties.label: Bar Chart
properties.query:
select 
	a.c_parameter2 as Infrastructure,
    a.c_value+0 as "Value"
from 
	app_fd_j_chart_data a
where 
	c_parameter1='Infrastructure As A Service'
order
	by a.c_value+0 desc
properties.title: Bar Chart: Global Market Share Of Cloud Infrastructure Services By Vendor

properties.customFooter: Note: Chart data are real values derived from your Joget system tables.
properties.label: Bar Chart, Stacked
properties.query:
select CONCAT(p.name,' v',p.appVersion) as 'AppName',
(select COUNT(*) from app_form s1 where s1.appId=p.appId) as 'TotalForms',
(select COUNT(*) from app_datalist s2 where s2.appId=p.appId) as 'TotalDatalists',
(select COUNT(*) from app_userview s3 where s3.appId=p.appId) as 'TotalUserviews'
from app_app p
where p.published=b'1'
group by AppName, TotalForms, TotalDatalists, TotalUserviews
order by TotalDatalists desc
limit 6
properties.title: Bar Chart, Stacked: Total Forms, Datalist & Userview in Apps

properties.customFooter: Note: Chart data are real values derived from your Joget system tables.
properties.label: Area Chart
properties.query:
select CONCAT(p.name,' v',p.appVersion) as 'AppName',
(select COUNT(*) from app_form s1 where s1.appId=p.appId) as 'TotalForms',
(select COUNT(*) from app_datalist s2 where s2.appId=p.appId) as 'TotalDatalists'
from app_app p
where p.published=b'1'
group by AppName, TotalForms, TotalDatalists
order by "Total Forms" desc
limit 5
properties.title: Area Chart: Total Number of Forms & Datalists in Apps

properties.customFooter: Note: Chart data are real values derived from your Joget system tables.
properties.label: Line Chart
properties.query:
select CONCAT(b.name,' v',a.appVersion) as 'AppName',
COUNT(a.appId) as 'TotalForms'
from app_form a
inner join app_app b on a.AppId=b.appId
where b.published=b'1'
group by AppName
order by TotalForms desc
limit 6
properties.title: Line Chart: Total Number of Forms in Apps

properties.customFooter: Note: Chart data are real values derived from your Joget system tables.
properties.label: XY Chart
properties.query:
select CONCAT(b.name,' v',a.appVersion) as 'AppName',
COUNT(a.appId) as 'TotalForms' 
from app_form a
inner join app_app b on a.AppId=b.appId
where b.published=b'1'
group by AppName
order by TotalForms desc
limit 6
properties.title: XY Chart: Total Number of Forms in Apps

properties.customFooter:
Legend:
Total number of forms represented by the outer ring.
Total number of datalist represented by the inner ring.
Note: Chart data are real values derived from your Joget system tables.
properties.label: Donut Chart
properties.query:
select CONCAT(p.name,' v',p.appVersion) as 'AppName',
(select COUNT(*) from app_form s1 where s1.appId=p.appId) as 'TotalForms',
(select COUNT(*) from app_datalist s2 where s2.appId=p.appId) as 'TotalDatalists'
from app_app p
where p.published=b'1'
group by AppName, TotalForms, TotalDatalists
order by TotalForms desc
limit 6
properties.title: Donut Chart: Total Forms & List In Apps

properties.customFooter: Note: Chart data are real values derived from your Joget system tables.
properties.label: Pie Chart
properties.query:
select CONCAT(b.name,' v',a.appVersion) as 'AppName',
COUNT(a.appId) as 'TotalForms' 
from app_form a
inner join app_app b on a.AppId=b.appId
where b.published=b'1'
group by AppName
order by TotalForms desc
limit 6
properties.title: Pie Chart: Total Forms in App

properties.customFooter: Note: Fictitious data for illustration purposes only.
properties.label: Stocks Candlestick Chart
properties.query:
select c_Date, (c_Open + 0) , (c_Highest + 0), (c_Lowest + 0), (c_Closing + 0)
from app_fd_j_stock
order by c_Date asc
properties.title: Stocks Candlestick Chart

properties.customFooter: Note: Fictitious data for illustration purposes only.
properties.label: Stocks OHLC Chart
properties.query:
select c_Date, (c_Open + 0) , (c_Highest + 0), (c_Lowest + 0), (c_Closing + 0) 
from app_fd_j_stock
order by c_Date asc
properties.title: Stocks OHLC Chart
